abstract: Pep Boys agreed to be bought by Bridgestone for $947 million, with the board of the car-parts chain deeming the latest offer from the tire company better than a competing bid from Carl Icahn.
snippet: Pep Boys agreed to be bought by Bridgestone for $947 million, with the board of the car-parts chain deeming the latest offer from the tire company better than a competing bid from Carl Icahn.
lead_paragraph: Pep Boys, the car-parts and servicing chain based in Philadelphia, agreed on Thursday to be acquired by Bridgestone for $947 million, rejecting a competing, and possibly larger, bid by the billionaire Carl C. Icahn.

headline.main: Pep Boys Accepts Higher Takeover Bid From Bridgestone
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Pep Boys Accepts Takeover Bid by Bridgestone for $947 Million
